org.artoolkitx.arx.arxj

Class ARController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.artoolkitx.arx.arxj.ARController

  • public class ARController
extends java.lang.Object
    The ARController class is a singleton which manages access to the underlying native functions defined in the ARX_jni class. Native calls should be made only from within this class so that adequate error checking and correct type conversion can take place.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ARController getInstance()
        Implementation of the singleton pattern to provide a sole instance of the ARController class.
        Returns:
        The single instance of ARController.

      • initialiseNative

        public boolean initialiseNative(java.lang.String resourcesDirectoryPath)
        Initialises the native code library if it is available.
        Parameters:
        resourcesDirectoryPath - The full path (in the filesystem) to the directory to be used by the native routines as the base for relative references. e.g. Activity.getContext().getCacheDir().getAbsolutePath() or Activity.getContext().getFilesDir().getAbsolutePath()
        Returns:
        true if the library was found and successfully initialised.

      • getARToolKitXVersion

        public java.lang.String getARToolKitXVersion()

      • start

        public boolean start(int videoWidth,
                     int videoHeight,
                     java.lang.String pixelFormat,
                     java.lang.String cameraParaPath,
                     int cameraIndex,
                     boolean cameraIsFrontFacing)
        Initialises the ARController.
        Parameters:
        videoWidth - The width of the video image in pixels.
        videoHeight - The height of the video image in pixels.
        pixelFormat - string with format in which buffers will be pushed. Supported values include "NV21", "NV12", "YUV_420_888", "RGBA", "RGB_565", and "MONO".
        cameraParaPath - Either: null to search for camera parameters specific to the device, or a path (in the filesystem) to a camera parameter file. The path may be an absolute path, or relative to the resourcesDirectoryPath set in initialiseNative().
        cameraIsFrontFacing - false to search for a rear-facing camera, or true to search for a camera facing toward the user.
        cameraIndex - Zero-based index of the camera in use, i.e. if 0, the first camera facing in the requested direction will be used, if 1 then the second etc.
        Returns:
        true if initialisation was successful.

      • getDebugMode

        public boolean getDebugMode()
        Returns whether the square tracker debug video image is enabled.
        Returns:
        Whether the square tracker debug video image is enabled.

      • setDebugMode

        public void setDebugMode(boolean debug)
        Enables or disables the debug video image in the square tracker.
        Parameters:
        debug - Whether or not to enable the square tracker debug video image.

      • getThreshold

        public int getThreshold()
        Returns the threshold used to binarize the video image for square marker detection.
        Returns:
        The current threshold value in the range 0 to 255, or -1 if the threshold could not be retrieved.

      • setThreshold

        public void setThreshold(int threshold)
        Sets the threshold used to binarize the video image for square marker detection.
        Parameters:
        threshold - The new threshold value in the range 0 to 255.

      • getProjectionMatrix

        public float[] getProjectionMatrix(float nearPlane,
                                   float farPlane)
        Returns the projection matrix calculated from camera parameters.
        Parameters:
        nearPlane - The value to use for the near OpenGL clipping plane.
        farPlane - The value to use for the far OpenGL clipping plane.
        Returns:
        A float array containing the OpenGL compatible projection matrix, or null if an error occurred.

      • addTrackable

        public int addTrackable(java.lang.String cfg)
        Adds a new single marker to the set of currently active markers.
        Parameters:
        cfg - The settings string for the used marker. Possible configurations look like this: `single;data/hiro.patt;80` `single_buffer;80;buffer=234 221 237...` `single_barcode;0;80` `multi;data/multi/marker.dat` `nft;data/nft/pinball`
        Returns:
        The unique identifier (UID) of the new marker, or -1 on error.

      • queryTrackableVisibilityAndTransformation

        public boolean queryTrackableVisibilityAndTransformation(int trackableUID,
                                                         float[] matrix)
        Returns whether the marker with the specified ID is currently visible, and if visible the trackable transformation.
        Parameters:
        trackableUID - The unique identifier (UID) of the trackable to query.
        Returns:
        true if the marker is visible and tracked in the current video frame.

      • isInited

        public boolean isInited()
        Queries whether artoolkitX is initialized. This will be true after a call to initialiseNative(String). At this point arwStartRunning and arwAndroidVideoPushInit can be called.
        Returns:
        true artoolkitX has been initialized

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns true when video and tracking are running.
        Returns:
        true when video and tracking are running, otherwise false

      • capture

        public boolean capture()
        Checks for a new frame available from the camera and captures it if so.
        Returns:
        true if frame was captured, otherwise false.

      • update

        public boolean update()
        Takes an incoming frame from the Android camera and passes it to native code for conversion and tracking.
        Returns:
        true if successful, otherwise false.

      • stopAndFinal

        public void stopAndFinal()
        Stop and final.

      • calculateReferenceMatrix

        public float[] calculateReferenceMatrix(int idMarkerBase,
                                        int idMarker2)
        Calculates the reference matrix for the given markers. First marker is the base.
        Parameters:
        idMarkerBase - Reference base
        idMarker2 - Marker that will be depending on that base
        Returns:
        Matrix that contains the transformation from @idMarkerBase to @idMarker2

      • distance

        public float distance(int referenceMarker,
                      int markerId2)
        Calculated the distance between two markers
        Parameters:
        referenceMarker - Reference base. Marker from which the distance is calculated
        markerId2 - Marker to which the distance is calculated
        Returns:
        distance

      • retrievePosition

        public float[] retrievePosition(int referenceMarkerId,
                                int markerIdToGetThePositionFor)
        Calculates the position depending on the referenceMarker
        Parameters:
        referenceMarkerId - Reference marker id
        markerIdToGetThePositionFor - Id of the marker for which the position is calculated
        Returns:
        Position vector with length 4 x,y,z,1

      • drawVideoInit

        public boolean drawVideoInit(int videoSourceIndex)
        Perform required initialisation for future drawing of video frames. Must be called from a rendering thread with an active rendering context.
        Parameters:
        videoSourceIndex - 0, or a video source with multiple inputs, the 0-based index of the active video source.
        Returns:
        true if successful

      • drawVideoSettings

                                 int width,

                                 boolean rotate90,

                                 boolean flipV,
                                 int hAlign,
                                 int vAlign,
                                 int scalingMode,
                                 int[] viewport)
        Set parameters of the rendering context for future drawing of video frames. Must be called from a rendering thread with an active rendering context.
        Parameters:
        videoSourceIndex - 0, or a video source with multiple inputs, the 0-based index of the active video source.
        Returns:
        true if successful

        Returns:
